Hi. I'm Danielle Black.

And I am running for an at-large seat in the Norwood City Council. I want you to know that serving on council is an honor for me. Ever since I was young I’ve wanted to be a voice for people who found themselves silenced. I stood up for the bullied and the meek. As your councilwoman I will make the most sound decisions my ethics and morals allow.

In this tense time for Norwood, there is no place for ego and malice, there is no place for personal interests and secrecy. It’s the light of hope I hear from so many friends and fellow citizens that keeps me pressing on, this hope is what will bring you to the polls, to the meet-and-greets and to choose me to serve on city council. I don’t know everything about local government, but I’m a fast learner and commit to being in the fight to move our city in a positive direction. I commit to giving my time and effort to you, Norwood friends, with hopes of a prosperous and successful future.

Here is how I intend to keep Norwood strong.

Odio turpis amet sed consequat eget posuere consequat.

Unity

Norwood is a community of almost 20,000 people squeezed into three square miles. We are native Norwoodians and transplants. We are young and old. We have an untapped potential for solving problems. To do that we need to hear all voices.

Growth

The Montgomery Road corridor and other hidden treasures can bring our prosperity back. I want to invigorate our local business sector throughout Norwood. Many storefronts and local splendors sit underutilized. Norwood can be a more wonderful place to live and visit.

Accountability

The Norwood municipal administration has for too long kept too much from the citizens it purports to serve. How many Norwood Day parades have come and gone while our infrastructure was allowed to degrade? Why isn't our infrastructure a higher priority?

Tell me what you think!

We have to work together.
